channel.title: Password glitch on old servers
channel.description:
Back in around 2006 or so I hosted a small server and basicly everytime someone logged in it would say there username and an encrypted password but every so often it would rarely glitch, I have no idea how but it would show passwords unencrypted.
Sure enough I tried logging in to real runescape with the few passwords I saw before it fixed itself And luckily for me someone cleverly used there own runeacape account name and password to log in to my server. I got full rune and a couple hundred k or so nothing too good but I just thought it was funny.
But I'm afraid this story takes a darker turn as when I got onto the account i was excited and changed the password thinking maybe I could use it or something, a couple days later I started feeling bad and had no need for the account and I didn't really need the items so I was gonna put them back on it but by then i couldn't remember what I changed the password to and It had no recoveries. Lord knows I felt bad. This guy checking out my own server and I stabbed him in the back.
I just had to clear my conscious haha.
Did this password glitch ever happen to anybody else?

item.title: Password glitch on old servers
item.dc:creator: @runerunerune runerunerune
item.description:
@runerunerune wrote:

[quote=“kronikz, post:13, topic:548994”][quote author=runerunerune link=topic=667902.msg4479005#msg4479005 date=1428327471]

It is their fault for using their actual RuneScape account details on any RSPS. But you, as the owner, shouldn’t be taking advantage of that by robbing them.

no problem cock boy

i disagree, it was funny.
[/quote]

thanks dickhead[/quote]

Read full topic

item.title: Password glitch on old servers
item.dc:creator: @sinisoul sini
item.description:
@sinisoul wrote:

it was a script exploit done by some idiot, they injected a custom script that wrote out your password to a user in a private message.

Read full topic

item.title: Password glitch on old servers
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“runerunerune, post:3, topic:548994”]When hosting a server on game client I think there was an option to look at scripts and it would show list of people loggin in to the server with account name and something like password:xxx2x9xx2xx25x, I don’t know something encrypted I didn’t create the server from scratch , that’s just what it did.
It was a glitch because most of the time it wouldn’t let you see peoples passwords but sometimes it did

And I was a greedy runescape kid , what do you expect

I didn’t seek to hack people but when I stumbled across this I took advantage[/quote]

That just makes you an asshole, not a greedy runescape kid.

Read full topic

item.title: Password glitch on old servers
item.dc:creator: @runerunerune runerunerune
item.description:
@runerunerune wrote:

Because every time they logged in it showed an encrypted password that was hidden but I did do that on the one rare occasion it showed the proper password of people logging in

@runerunerune wrote:

When hosting a server on game client I think there was an option to look at scripts and it would show list of people loggin in to the server with account name and something like password:xxx2x9xx2xx25x, I don’t know something encrypted I didn’t create the server from scratch , that’s just what it did.
It was a glitch because most of the time it wouldn’t let you see peoples passwords but sometimes it did

And I was a greedy runescape kid , what do you expect

I didn’t seek to hack people but when I stumbled across this I took advantage

item.title: Password glitch on old servers
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“runerunerune, post:1, topic:548994”]Back in around 2006 or so I hosted a small server and basicly everytime someone logged in it would say there username and an encrypted password but every so often it would rarely glitch, I have no idea how but it would show passwords unencrypted.

Sure enough I tried logging in to real runescape with the few passwords I saw before it fixed itself
And luckily for me someone cleverly used there own runeacape account name and password to log in to my server. I got full rune and a couple hundred k or so nothing too good but I just thought it was funny.

But I’m afraid this story takes a darker turn as when I got onto the account i was excited and changed the password thinking maybe I could use it or something, a couple days later I started feeling bad and had no need for the account and I didn’t really need the items so I was gonna put them back on it but by then i couldn’t remember what I changed the password to and It had no recoveries. Lord knows I felt bad. This guy checking out my own server and I stabbed him in the back.

I just had to clear my conscious haha.

Did this password glitch ever happen to anybody else?[/quote]

How the hell is that a glitch? Why the hell would you access someone’s account in the first place? Why are you showing anyone the encrypted password?

Read full topic
